meanings.definition: The coiled young fronds of a fern, often used as a vegetable.
meanings.sent1: I picked some fiddleheads to cook for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The fiddleheads were delicious when sautéed with garlic.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully tossed the fiddleheads in the pan.
meanings.sent4: The fiddleheads unfurled like tiny green scrolls in the pot.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with people buying fresh fiddleheads.

meanings.definition: To fiddle with something in a nervous or aimless way.
meanings.sent1: She nervously fiddleheads with her pen during the exam.
meanings.sent2: Stop fiddleheads with the remote control and just choose a channel.
meanings.sent3: The toddler fiddleheads with the buttons on the toy, unsure what to do.
meanings.sent4: He fiddleheads with his tie, trying to get it just right.
meanings.sent5: The student fiddleheads with the zipper on the backpack, delaying the start of class.
